categories.summary:
# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ’¬-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion primarily focused on critical bugs and UX issues with elizacloud.ai platform. The most significant technical issue reported was a serious bug in the welcome email system where promised $5 credits were not being added to new accounts, and worse, clicking the "get started" button was overwriting existing accounts and agents, creating new accounts with only $1 balance instead. This represents a critical customer retention blocker.

Payment and account recharging limitations were identified as major obstacles to customer onboarding and retention. Users cannot transfer tokens between accounts to help friends recharge, and VPN users are blocked from accessing payment pages. A proposed solution involves implementing wallet addresses for each account to enable direct crypto token deposits without wallet connection requirements.

Additional feature suggestions included implementing a referral program to incentivize user acquisition and retention. The lack of easy payment options was identified as causing customer loss at the critical conversion point when trial users want to become paying customers.

A query about Meta Threads plugin availability was answered negatively by Odilitime. Other non-technical discussions involved suggestions for AI agents trained on public document releases, though these were more conceptual than actionable development items.

The sam user responded to investigate the email/account bug by requesting the affected user's details for debugging.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Any meta threads plugin? (asked by sazilariel) A: Not that I'm aware of (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: sam | Helpee: yojo | Context: Critical bug with welcome email not adding $5 credits and overwriting existing accounts | Resolution: sam requested email/address to investigate the issue

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Fix critical bug where welcome email $5 credits are not added to new accounts | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Technical | Description: Fix bug where clicking "get started" in welcome email overwrites existing accounts and agents, creating new account with $1 balance | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Technical | Description: Stop sending welcome emails until account overwrite bug is fixed | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Feature | Description: Implement wallet addresses for each account to enable token deposits for account recharging without wallet connection | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Feature | Description: Enable token transfers between accounts to allow users to recharge friends' accounts | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Feature | Description: Fix VPN blocking issue on payment page linkout | Mentioned By: yojo
Type: Feature | Description: Implement referral program with rewards for converting paying customers | Mentioned By: yojo

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The chat focused on debugging and deploying babylon.market, a platform with user authentication and reward systems. Multiple API endpoints were failing, affecting page functionality. SYMBiEX managed the deployment, offering admin/mod access to users signing up with ElizaLabs.ai emails.

Key technical issues identified: username creation bug causing users to receive "@userid:priv" as usernames instead of proper usernames, broken Discord OAuth for account linking, and non-functional Twitter follow reward claiming with error messages. SYMBiEX committed to investigating both issues.

A fix for the OAuth/reward issues was pushed by user ID 688478180306452573 but initially wasn't merged to production. After confirmation from tcm390, the fix was merged to production, allowing testing to proceed. The team coordinated timing for testing the fixes.

Additional discussion included access restrictions limiting participation to top 100 users, with Agent Joshua requesting approval for "hashwarlock" to test. The chat also included non-technical discussion about Claude Opus 4.6 release from Anthropic, with team members expressing interest in the new model at the same price point as 4.5.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Are you pushing new updates? (asked by s) A: Answered implicitly - fixes were being pushed and merged (answered by SYMBiEX, tcm390)

Q: How do I get admin/mod access on babylon.market? (asked by SYMBiEX) A: Sign up with ElizaLabs.ai email for automatic access, or provide username for manual modding (answered by SYMBiEX)

Q: Why am I getting @userid:priv as username? (asked by ziflie) A: Username creation bug being investigated (answered by SYMBiEX)

Q: Is Discord OAuth for account linking working? (asked by Stan âš¡) A: It's broken, being investigated (answered by SYMBiEX)

Q: Will the fix be merged today/tomorrow for testing? (asked by Stan âš¡) A: It has been merged (answered by tcm390)

Q: Can you approve hashwarlock for testing? (asked by Agent Joshua â‚± | TEE) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: SYMBiEX <<CidSociety>> | Helpee: ziflie | Context: Username creation showing @userid:priv instead of proper usernames | Resolution: Committed to investigate the issue

Helper: SYMBiEX <<CidSociety>> | Helpee: Stan âš¡ | Context: Discord OAuth and Twitter follow reward claiming broken | Resolution: Committed to investigate, fix was pushed and merged to production

Helper: tcm390 | Helpee: Stan âš¡ | Context: Checking if fix was merged to production for testing | Resolution: Confirmed the fix has been merged to production

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Investigate username creation bug causing @userid:priv usernames | Mentioned By: SYMBiEX <<CidSociety>>

Type: Technical | Description: Fix Discord OAuth for account linking | Mentioned By: SYMBiEX <<CidSociety>>

Type: Technical | Description: Fix Twitter follow reward claiming errors | Mentioned By: SYMBiEX <<CidSociety>>

Type: Technical | Description: Approve hashwarlock user for testing outside top 100 restriction | Mentioned By: Agent Joshua â‚± | TEE

Type: Technical | Description: Fix failing API endpoints affecting page functionality | Mentioned By: sam

# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ’¬-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered primarily on the AI16Z to ELIZAOS token migration deadline and community concerns. The migration window, which had been open since November (90 days), closed, causing frustration among users who were absent during this period. sam.mrk criticized the two-week deadline (later corrected to 90 days) as insufficient for investors who may be traveling or away from their wallets, arguing the team should have extended it to a year or automatically airdropped tokens. Community members clarified this was a migration, not an airdrop, and that unmigrated tokens would be locked for one year.

Technical discussions included shoemaker6765 experiencing migration issues and being targeted by scammers. Odilitime warned about scammer activity in the channel. zelm1 raised concerns about fake projects launching on Babylon wallet falsely claiming association with Shaw, requesting clarification via tweet to prevent dev selling under his name.

Project updates included Odilitime confirming work continues on degenai, which performed well in Babylon test games with real tests upcoming. The team is focused on the Babylon launch. M I A M I promoted "rentasoul," a platform where users can give their soul to AI agents, bring Eliza agents, or complete tasks for payment.

Developer outreach included aicodeflow offering 8 years of AI/automation engineering experience, CT sharing CERBERUS-AGI (a Trollstore AI-Driven Software in beta), and Rishab seeking beta testers for an x402-based payment gateway for AI agents on Solana. Technical questions included "some" asking about which Eliza version works properly with the Twitter plugin locally, which went unanswered.

## 2. FAQ

Q: I couldn't migrate my tokens, trying all day, how do I make a ticket or get help? (asked by shoemaker6765) A: Odilitime warned the person helping was a scammer (answered by Odilitime)

Q: What's going on with degenai? Is anything being worked on, or has it been abandoned? (asked by gby) A: It has not been abandoned, still working on it, was owning the Babylon test game with real test coming up (answered by Odilitime)

Q: What version of the eliza are you using for the Twitter plugin to local work properly? (asked by some) A: Unanswered

Q: What will happen to non migrated Eliza tokens do they stay locked up forever or something? (asked by Biazs) A: Locked for a year (answered by jasyn_bjorn)

Q: Why are there so many tokens, it should only be elizaos? (asked by g) A: What Shaw does in react to people reacting to him has nothing to do with elizaOS or labs, focused on Babylon launch (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Tefal Generous Non Stick In | Helpee: shoemaker6765 | Context: Token migration issues | Resolution: User was talking to someone but Odilitime warned it was a scammer

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: shoemaker6765 | Context: User being contacted by scammer about migration help | Resolution: Warning issued that contact was a scammer

Helper: Kenk | Helpee: sam.mrk | Context: Misunderstanding about migration deadline (thought it was 2 weeks) | Resolution: Clarified token migration has been open since November

Helper: jasyn_bjorn | Helpee: sam.mrk | Context: Confusion about migration timeline | Resolution: Confirmed it's been 90 days and it's a migration not an airdrop

Helper: jasyn_bjorn | Helpee: Biazs | Context: Question about what happens to non-migrated tokens | Resolution: Clarified tokens are locked for a year

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: gby | Context: Concerns about degenai project abandonment | Resolution: Confirmed project is not abandoned and still being worked on

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: g | Context: Confusion about multiple tokens diluting attention | Resolution: Explained Shaw's personal activities are separate from elizaOS/labs, team focused on Babylon launch

## 4. Action Items

Type: Feature | Description: Beta testing needed for x402 payment gateway for AI agents on Solana | Mentioned By: Rishab

Type: Feature | Description: Review and provide feedback on CERBERUS-AGI Trollstore AI-Driven Software in beta | Mentioned By: CT

Type: Documentation | Description: Shaw needs to clarify via tweet that fake projects on Babylon wallet are not funded by him to prevent dev selling under his name | Mentioned By: zelm1

Type: Technical | Description: Determine which Eliza version works properly with Twitter plugin locally | Mentioned By: some

Type: Technical | Description: Continue development work on degenai for upcoming real Babylon test | Mentioned By: Odilitime
